Key Match Events: Mohamed Salah injured at the 45th minute
Mohammed Kudus scored the first goal for Ghana
Omar Marmoush scored an equalizer for Egypt in the 69th minute
Mohammed Kudus scored a powerful shot that gave Ghana the lead again
Mostafa Mohamed scored an equalizer for Egypt
Pre-Game Insights: Egypt and Ghana were touted as the two teams that would comfortably top their easy-looking Group B
Both teams needed to avoid a defeat to have legitimate aspirations of reaching the knockout stages
Ghana had a shock 2-1 defeat to Cape Verde in their first match
Egypt was held to a 2-2 draw by Mozambique in their first game
Both Egypt and Ghana will be keenly watching tomorrowâ€™s clash between Cape Verde and Mozambique while hoping for a result that can be good for their respective qualification chances
Post-Match Reflections: Safaa Kasraoui noted that both teams played with energy and determination
Egypt's coach Walid Regragui might be disappointed with the result
Ghana's Black Stars are now on a dipping run of six AFCON games without a win
Egypt has underperformed and even disappointed by collecting only two points in two games
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match ended in a 2-2 draw
Mohamed Salah's last-minute spot kick saved a crucial one point for Egypt in their first game
Ghana needs a statement victory in their final group match against Mozambique to hope to qualify to the round of 16 stages
Egypt will go into their final game needing a victory to qualify to the next round
